text:
After creating my password file, I try accessing a restricted portion of my web
site and am unable to obtain access.  I have removed references to the password
requirement and access without difficulty, so the issue seems to be the password
file.  Patches htpasswd-c-and-n-options-conflict and
htpasswd-overwrites-old-file have been applied already.

Mike
creator: mike.soules@td.com

text:
You'll have to give us more details here.  Did it work in a previous version of 
Apache with exactly the same configuration?  Or is this a new problem?  
Furthermore, does the .htpasswd file created look "right" (don't post the real 
one here, obviously)?  What configuration are you using? 
 
The best approach to fixing this would probably be to either discuss it on the 
users mailing list (see http://httpd.apache.org/userslist.html) or on the 
#apache channel on irc.openprojects.net and report back here when you've 
tracked down exactly what the problem is. 
 
Thanks for using Apache!
creator: jwoolley@apache.org

text:
Yes, the creation of the password file worked perfectly fine under 2.0.36 
providing the correct access to various pages.  The password file looks fine, 
user ID with a ":" then the password in encrypted format.  To me, this appears 
to be a new problem.  I searched the bug database prior to posting, sorry for 
any breach of protocol.
creator: mike.soules@td.com
nd@perlig.de
text:
hmm. I'm assuming that the problem was fixed or a config error.
If not and you can provide more information, please reopen this report.

Thanks.
